org.protune.net
Interface Pointer

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
AddressPortPointer, DispatcherPointer
public interface Pointer
extends java.io.Serializable

In order to grant that communication among nodes actually takes place, it is required that the information sent by one node is received by the other one, which means that each node needs to have a reference (pointer) to the location of the other one. The interface Pointer represents the abstraction of a reference to a remote service. A concrete implementation can simply exploit socket (as the current one in the Protune system) or whatever more complex communication means (RPC, RMI, Web Services ...), as long as the method sendMessage(Message) is provided, ensuring that the information which should be received by the other node is actually sent.

Author:
jldecoi
